    • Method Detail

      • createTargetURIOptions

        public static java.util.Collection<Option> createTargetURIOptions(java.net.URI uri)
                                                           throws java.net.URISyntaxException,
                                                                  InvalidOptionException
        Creates all URI related options from the given URI
        Parameters:
        uri - URI to extract the URI options from
        Returns:
        A collection containing the appropriate amount of target URI related options
        Throws:
        java.net.URISyntaxException - if the URI is not absolute, has scheme which is not coap or coaps, or has a fragment part
        InvalidOptionException - if at least one of the target URI related options to be created does not match the criteria defined for the option type

      • createProxyUriOptions

        public static java.util.Collection<Option> createProxyUriOptions(java.net.URI uri)
                                                          throws InvalidOptionException,
                                                                 java.net.URISyntaxException
        This method creates one or more Proxy-URI options. More than one option is created if the length of the encoded URI string is more than 270. All but the last created options payload has a length of 270 bytes. Note that only absolute URIs are allowed to be added as Proxy URI.
        Parameters:
        uri - The URI to be added as Proxy URI option(s)
        Returns:
        The amount of options added to the list
        Throws:
        java.net.URISyntaxException - if the URI to be added is not absolute
        InvalidOptionException - if one of the proxy URI options to be created is not valid

      • createLocationUriOptions

        public static java.util.Collection<Option> createLocationUriOptions(java.net.URI uri)
                                                             throws InvalidOptionException
        Location path and location query options are used to define the path of a newly created resource in a response to a POST message. Each option in the returned Option[] contains one fragement of the full path, resp. full query string. Fragments are created by seperating the full string using a seperator ("/" for the path and "&" for the query). E.g. The relative URI "path/example?value1=1&value2=2" results into 4 options: 2 location path options (path and example) and 2 location query options (value1=1 and value2=2)
        Parameters:
        uri - URI to be added as location path and location query option(s)
        Returns:
        A collection of options containing the appropriate amount of Location URI related options.
        Throws:
        InvalidOptionException - if one of the location URI related options to be created is not valid

      • createStringOption

        public static StringOption createStringOption(OptionRegistry.OptionName optionName,
                              java.lang.String value)
                                       throws InvalidOptionException
        Creates and returns a StringOption instance with given name and value
        Parameters:
        optionName - The name of the option
        value - A String representing the options value
        Returns:
        appropriate StringOption instance
        Throws:
        InvalidOptionException - if the given name is not a StringOptions name

        Throws:

      • createOption

        public static Option createOption(OptionRegistry.OptionName optionName,
                  byte[] value)
                           throws InvalidOptionException
        Creates and returns option instance of the appropriate type according to the given name
        Parameters:
        optionName - The name of the option
        value - A long representing the options value (which is of type unsigned int)
        Returns:
        appropriate Option instance (may be StringOption, UintOption, OpaqueOption or EmptyOption)
        Throws:
        InvalidOptionException
